isis.stitle: ELECTRICAL SYSTEM TROUBLESHOOTING GUIDE / 9200 9300 9400 MODELS BUILT AFTER JANUARY 1, 1995 - ELECTRONIC ENGINE CONTROLS - CATERPILLAR - 1992 - 1993 - DIAGNOSTICS - DETERMINING FAULT CODES

svcprocinfo.para: MPSI (Pro Link) or Caterpillar electronic service tools (EST) can be used to identify logged fault codes. Refer to the EST manual for operating instructions.
The yellow "Engine Warning" light can be used to read fault codes by following the procedure in paragraph Reading Flash Codes below.

svcsubproc.title: Reading Flash Codes
svcsubproc.para: When the key is turned to the ignition position, the yellow "Engine Warning" light turns ON for approximately 6 seconds, then turns OFF for several more seconds, then begins to FLASH any logged fault codes. All Caterpillar flash codes are two digit numbers. If there are no logged fault codes, the ECM will FLASH a code 55.

step1.para: Start engine and allow to run at low idle for about 30 seconds.
Turn Cruise ON/OFF switch to OFF position.
Hold Cruise SET/RESUME switch in RESUME position until codes begin to FLASH, then release.

note.para: All Caterpillar flash codes are two digit numbers.

step1.para: The yellow Engine Warning light will FLASH the first digit. At the end of first digit there is a one or two second pause.
The yellow Engine Warning light will FLASH the second digit. At the end of the second digit there will be a two or three second pause before the next fault code number is FLASHED.

The second and all successive fault codes will FLASH until all codes have been FLASHED. It will stop FLASHING after the last code has been flashed. To see the fault codes again, repeat steps 4 through 8.

Caterpillar fault codes are listed in the Caterpillar Engine Manual that comes with the truck. The codes are also listed in the Prolink Caterpillar Cartridge Manual and Caterpillar Service literature.
